p: Central stress system activation would be expected to produce lymphopenia from HPA axis stimulation. Neutrophilia may reflect effects of glucocorticoids [ 181] or catecholamines. In healthy volunteers adrenaline infusion acutely evokes leukocytosis, neutrophilia, and lymphocytosis and increases the activity and numbers of natural killer cells [ 181]. The effects of circulating catecholamines depend on the types of occupied adrenoceptors. Adrenaline, which stimulates both types of adrenoceptor, results more in beta-adrenoreceptor-mediated effects [ 11].
